Hey y'all my fellow Wota-s,

This was transcribed by ear while listening to the record transposed 3 semitones down.
The original song starts at Bb but I transposed it to G because it's easier to pick-up and play.
To play at original key, use CAPO 3 or transpose +3 using UG's own transpose function on the side-bar.

Tried to match timing of chord changes by playing it but would be better to listen to the original for cues.

Also chords are simplified to the basic form & beats, there are minor movements between the chords
listed here. This can be picked up by ear if you listen to the original, there are subtle variations between
chords. Usually it happens during certain chord changes from one chord to the other. Have fun! \(^O^)/

                                                                                                 ~by V.Sujay

Song: Gallup, New Mexico
Artist: The Shouting Matches
Tabbed by: Mitch Peters

Its only really two chords through the song; F#m to E, but the guitar organ throw in 
some variations occasionally, mostly F#m7 and an E chord with an added b note (when i play 
the barr chord with the A string  base note, i just take my pinky off to achieve the variation).

[ch]F#m[/ch]                       [ch]E[/ch]
On to Gallup, on to San Antonio
[ch]F#m[/ch]                                  [ch]E[/ch]
It was in Phoenix, yeah, I was on the radio
    [ch]F#m[/ch]            [ch]E[/ch]
Ah hi hi ah hi hi Abilene

When you know, yeah
    [ch]F#m[/ch]
You know that your lies are talking
                                                [ch]E[/ch]
You know that your lies are walking with the truth

Through El Paso, you passed me up so long ago
It was a hard and calling road, I've been denied

Just when you know that
You know that your lies are talking
When you know that your lies are walking with the truth
And you were always looking
And I was always cooking up the proof

That's when you know that
When you know that your lies are talking
You know that your lies are walking with the truth
When you were always looking
And I was always cooking up the proof
